definition: to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Sippy and directed by Ramesh Sippy, released in 1975.
sentences.chinese: 播出，并指示由拉梅什风格，发表于1975年。

sentences.english: Recently, have you seen 3D cartoon film Pigman in CCTVstation?
sentences.chinese: 最近，你看过中央台播出的3D卡通片《猪猪侠》吗？

sentences.english: It seems to be shown on CCTV Channel 1 everyday.
sentences.chinese: 那个广告好像每天都在央视一套播出。

sentences.english: The first television broadcasts began in 1936.
sentences.chinese: BBC在1936年播出了第一个电视节目。

sentences.english: Every year, the show will release the new season and the stories keep pace with the time.
sentences.chinese: 每年，该节目会播出新季，故事也会与时俱进。

sentences.english: This had better not go on the air before summer!
sentences.chinese: 这最好不在夏天之前播出。

sentences.english: Voice commentary for a TV-like broadcast of the match.
sentences.chinese: 语音解说了本场比赛类似电视的播出。

sentences.english: It was broadcast by al-Arabiya TV on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 这个录音在周日由阿拉伯人电视台播出了。

sentences.english: No episode or date of his cameo are mentioned.
sentences.chinese: 大卫的客串将在哪一天哪一集播出尚而知。

sentences.english: This realistic melodrama about urban people's emotional life became an instant hot topic among the audience.
sentences.chinese: 这部现实题材的都市情感剧一播出就引发观众的热议。

sentences.english: The news will be on the air at 6p.
sentences.chinese: 这条新闻将在下午六点播出。

sentences.english: At this moment, the klaxon sounded again. The music of departure was heard in the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 这时，汽笛又是一声长鸣，舱中播出了送别的音乐。

sentences.english: The most vigorous protests, in London and Paris, were played out for prime-time newscasts.
sentences.chinese: 最强烈的伦敦和巴黎抗议报道在黄金时段播出。

sentences.english: The song also became a homefront favorite, broadcast regularly on Radio Berlin. “My son has fallen,” wrote one German mother to composer Schultze.
sentences.chinese: 在后方，这首歌也广受欢迎，在柏林电台定期播出。

sentences.english: The most wonderful program has been recorded sound and has sowed out in the transmitter-receiver.
sentences.chinese: 最精采的节目已录了音并在电台播出。

sentences.english: Under the initiative, 10-second clips of around two dozen new movies would be shown as the show's credits roll.
sentences.chinese: 据说会有24部左右的新片的十秒剪辑滚动播出。

definition: program/item (on a program)/CL:臺|台[tai2],個|个[ge4],套[tao4]
prime time
to watch TV
TV play/soap opera/CL:部[bu4]
ratings (of a TV show)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to broadcast a film/to televise
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
to replay/to rerun/(agriculture) to reseed/to oversow
satellite TV (abbr. for 衛星電視|卫星电视[wei4 xing1 dian4 shi4])
trial broadcast
variety show
to broadcast over a network/(radio or TV) hookup/simulcast
wide range of performing arts
China Central Television (CCTV), abbr. for 中國中央電視台|中国中央电视台[Zhong1 guo2 Zhong1 yang1 Dian4 shi4 tai2]
to show (a movie)/to screen
